title: SA lifts ban on genetically modified crops
text:
South Australian farmers will now be able to grow genetically modified crops after a 15-year moratorium on the practice was lifted statewide on January 1.

South Australia’s Primary Industries Minister Tim Whetstone said genetically modified farming “gives our farmers the choice and the tools that they need” when it comes to “dealing with variable climate”.

However, Mr Whetstone has come under fire for making the regulatory change after his bill was blocked by parliament.

Image: Getty
